generif.text: PSTPIP1 acts downstream of CD2/CD2AP to link CD2 engagement to the WASp-evoked actin polymerization required for synapse formation and T cell activation.
cortactin links receptor endocytosis to actin polymerization by binding both CD2AP and the Arp2/3 complex, which may facilitate the trafficking of internalized growth factor receptors
Cd2 antigen is linked to CAPZ via this protein and CIN85

two patients with focal segmental glomerulosclerosis had a mutation predicted to ablate expression of one CD2AP allele, implicating CD2AP as a determinant of human susceptibility to glomerular disease
exposure to normal and non-nephrotic human plasma leads to a concentration of nephrin, podocin, CD2AP, and actin at the cell surface in podocytes
CD2AP is involved in cytokinesis.
CD2AP has a role in the regulation of the actin cytoskeleton
CFBP is a novel tyrosine-phosphorylated protein that might function as a regulator of CIN85/CD2AP
structures support the notion that, despite clear differences in the interaction surface, both Cbl-b and CD2 can mediate multimerization of N-terminal CMS SH3 domains

This work indicates the solution structure of CMS_SH3_B bears the canonical beta-beta-beta-beta-alpha-beta fold and a new binding site in c-Cbl involved in its interaction with CMS, which probably contributes to the clustering of CMS.

CIN85 is expressed as multiple isoforms that share the coiled-coil domain, suggesting that heterotypic interactions with CMS provides a mechanism to regulate CMS binding to F-actin and thus for modulating dynamic rearrangements of the cytoskeleton.
Focal segmental glomerulosclerosis in a patient homozygous for a CD2AP mutation.

identified a polyproline-arginine sequence in the pTalpha cytoplasmic tail that interacted in vitro with SH3 domains of the CIN85/CMS family of adaptors, and mediated the recruitment of multiprotein complexes involving all (CMS, CIN85, and CD2BP3) members
that ALIX and TSG101/ESCRT-I also bind a series of proteins involved in cytokinesis, including CEP55, CD2AP, ROCK1, and IQGAP1.

The three-dimensional structure of CD2AP SH3-C contains all the features that are typically found in other SH3 domains, including the general binding site for the recognition of polyproline sequences.
promotor activity in rental tubular epithelial cells is regulated by CREB and Sp1
Sp1/Sp3 binding sites play a critical role in the CD2AP regulation.
CD2AP mutations modify the interaction with CD2 in lymphocytes and alter the composition of the renal slit diaphragm.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
CD2AP, through facilitating conjugate formation and directed transport of lytic granules, plays an important role in NK cells killing.
The absence of mutations of CD2AP in this study suggests that there are other genetic causes of steroid-resistant nephrotic syndrome
Clinical trial of gene-disease association and gene-environment interaction. (HuGE Navigator)
Data identify CD2AP as a novel Rac1-associated adapter protein that participates in the regulation of epithelial cell-cell contact.
Coexpression of CIN85/Ruk(L) with CD2AP led to a decreased binding of CIN85/Ruk(L) to nephrin and podocin, which indicates a functional competition between CD2AP and CIN85/Ruk(L).

The authors report that CD2AP, an endocytosis-associated and cortactin-binding protein, is a novel and important component of enteropathogenic Escherichia coli pedestal formation that also utilizes Y474 phosphorylation of the bacterial Tir.
found independent evidence for association for Alzheimer's disease susceptibility loci at EPHA1, CD33 and CD2AP
Common variants at MS4A4/MS4A6E, CD2AP, CD33 and EPHA1 are associated with late-onset Alzheimer's disease.
found that the N-terminal SH3 domain of both adaptor proteins CD2AP and CIN85 are the most stable SH3 domains that have been studied until now
The urinary mRNA profiles of synaptopodin, podocalyxin, CD2-AP, alpha-actin4, and podocin were found to increase with the progression of diabetic nephropathy.
identifies CD2AP as the gatekeeper of the podocyte TGF-beta response through its regulation of CatL expression and defines a molecular mechanism underlying proteinuric kidney disease
CD2AP is highly expressed in human plasmacytoid dendritic cells (DC) and positively regulates blood DC antigen 2 (BDCA2)/Fc fragment of IgE high affinity I receptor (FcepsilonR1gamma) signaling.
E2F1 up-regulates the human CD2AP promoter.
an FRS2beta-CIN85/CD2AP-Cbl axis for downregulation of ErbB2 may regulate ErbB2 protein levels in physiological and pathological settings
CD2AP gene variants may contribute to susceptibility to end-stage renal disease in patients with type 1 diabetes.
FSGS3/CD2AP has a role of barbed-end capping in junctional actin dynamics.
CD2AP rs9349407 polymorphism contributes to Alzheimer's disease susceptibility.

we present the first demonstration that the purified SH3 domains of the CD2AP/Cin85 protein family are able to directly bind the p53 protein, and to discriminate between the two polymorphic variants P72R
CD2-Associated Protein affects Abeta levels and Abeta42/Abeta40 ratio in vitro
discovered novel interaction candidates for CD2AP and characterized subtle yet significant differences in the recognition preferences of its three SH3 domains for c-CBL, ALIX, and RIN3
Study found a novel association of CD2AP with plasma homocysteine in participants with African ancestry and found a new variant in the candidate gene CBS associated with homocysteine
CD2AP expression in renal tubules may histologically associate with tissue hypoxia and reflected recovery from CsA-mediated renal injury in nephrotic syndrome patients.
data thus reveal a Golgi-traversing pathway for exosomal release of the cargo protein GPRC5B in which CD2AP facilitates the entry and LMAN2 impedes the exit of the flux, respectively.

Silencing Cindr in nephrocytes led to dramatic nephrocyte functional impairment and shortened life span, as well as collapse of nephrocyte lacunar channels and effacement of nephrocyte slit diaphragms. These phenotypes could be rescued by expression of a wild-type human CD2AP gene, but not a mutant allele derived from a patient with CD2AP-associated NS.
CD2AP is an sporadic-Alzheimer's-disease risk gene in a southern Chinese Han population.

data suggest that CD2AP acts as a negative regulator of ICAM-1 clustering, which limits the formation of ICAM-1 adhesion complexes to prevent uncontrolled neutrophil adhesion and transcellular transmigration.

PAWS1 interacts in a dynamic fashion with the actin/cytoskeletal regulator CD2AP at lamellae, suggesting that its association with CD2AP controls actin organization and cellular migration. Genetic ablation of CD2AP from U2OS cells instigates actin and cell migration defects reminiscent of those seen in PAWS1-knockout cells.

CD2AP is indicated as a protein up-regulated by HCV infection, which, in turn, stimulates HCV propagation and steatosis by disrupting insulin signaling; targeting CD2AP may offer an opportunity for alleviating HCV infection and its associated liver pathology

Study identified a homozygous frameshift mutation in CD2AP (p.S198fs) in three siblings born of consanguineous parents who developed childhood-onset focal segmental glomerulosclerosis (FSGS) and end stage renal disease. When the same mutation was introduced in mice by gene editing, the mice developed FSGS and kidney failure. These results provide conclusive evidence that homozygous mutation of CD2AP causes FSGS in humans.
Excessive apoptosis of podocytes caused by dysregulation of microRNA-182-5p and CD2AP confers to an increased risk of diabetic nephropathy.
tyrosine in position Y10 of the SH3-1 domain of CD2AP is indispensable for CD2AP function in vivo.

The authors demonstrate that CD2AP interaction with hypervariable domains of Chikungunya virus nsP3 is mediated by its SH3-A and SH3-C domains, and this leaves the SH3-B domain available for interaction with other cellular factor(s).
The upregulation of CD2-associated protein (CD2AP) could attenuate gastric cancer (GC) metastasis, suggesting CD2AP as a biomarker for the prognosis and treatment of patients with GC.
Association of the CD2AP locus with cognitive functioning among middle-aged individuals with a family history of Alzheimer's disease.
Long non-coding RNA TTC28-AS1 attenuates high glucose-induced damage in HK-2 cells depending on the regulation of miR-320a/CD2AP axis.
Alzheimer's disease susceptibility locus in CD2AP is associated with increased cerebrospinal fluid tau levels in mild cognitive impairment.
Studying the Association of TKS4 and CD2AP Scaffold Proteins and Their Implications in the Partial Epithelial-Mesenchymal Transition (EMT) Process.

name: CD2 associated protein
other_names: Cas ligand with multiple Src homology (SH) 3 domains
Cas ligand with multiple Src homology 3 (SH3) domains
cas ligand with multiple SH3 domains

kegg.name: Bacterial invasion of epithelial cells - Homo sapiens (human)

pid.name: Nephrin/Neph1 signaling in the kidney podocyte

summary: This gene encodes a scaffolding molecule that regulates the actin cytoskeleton. The protein directly interacts with filamentous actin and a variety of cell membrane proteins through multiple actin binding sites, SH3 domains, and a proline-rich region containing binding sites for SH3 domains. The cytoplasmic protein localizes to membrane ruffles, lipid rafts, and the leading edges of cells. It is implicated in dynamic actin remodeling and membrane trafficking that occurs during receptor endocytosis and cytokinesis. Haploinsufficiency of this gene is implicated in susceptibility to glomerular disease. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
